title: Binary Domain
notes:
In each launch this message is displayed: You must use "Turn Windows features on or off" in the Control Panell to install or configure Microsoft .Net Framework 3.0.

Bodies of water present bugs.
It keeps complaining about not being able to install .Net Framework 3.5. But the game starts. Default mouse sensitivity is crazy.
title: Binary Domain

notes: To prevent Net Framework installation error you can remove (or rename) dotNetFx35setup.exe in "redist" directory.
title: Binary Domain

notes: .Net Framework does not install correctly, but game launches anyway. Need to run configuration utility before game will start. Xbox 360 controller mapped incorrectly making it unusable; this seems to be an issue on Windows as well, so workarounds for that OS might provide some clues for how to fix it on Proton.
title: Binary Domain

gpu: X.Org AMD Radeon (TM) R9 Fury Series (FIJI, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.9-1-MANJARO, LLVM 6.0.1)
notes: .Net Framework does not install correctly, but game launches anyway. Didn't try to use controller.
title: Binary Domain

notes: Single player works flawlessly out of the box. Multiplayer wasn't tested. For proper controller mappings, start from big picture mode after setting up controller in BP.
title: Binary Domain

notes: Like others have said, .Net Framework doesn't install correctly, but game launches normally; must run configuration utility before entering the game; and although it's possible to change input from keyboard to XBox 360 controller in the configuration utility, using controller in game results in the camera continuously spinning around.
title: Binary Domain

notes: .Net Framework installation errors can be avoided by removing or renaming the installation file in the game's "redist" folder. Busted xinput controller mapping can be worked around around by unplugging the controller/receiver, starting the game and plugging it back in when the title screen appears. The latter doesn't seem to be a Proton specific issue as it happens on Windows as well.
title: Binary Domain
